comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Wonderful image! The SS Yarra was built in 1883 in Marseilles, France, and sunk by a German submarine (UC-74) torpedo in the eastern Mediterranean on 27/5/1917. More info - www.wrecksite.eu/wreck.aspx?132094 .

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] I think the Oyster Bar (ex public toilets) is behind to the left, and probably not yet built in 1906 

The photographer (looks like John Degotardi Jnr?) must have been on top of the 1883 Hill Clark & Co. building - 
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3594418492/]
